nodes.text: The Deactivated Camp was a Trade Federation base built during the Invasion of Naboo in 32 BBY. It contained the forces of the droid Commander OOM-14, which were rendered immobile by the loss of a droid control program until it was recovered by the droid OOM-9.

The Deactivated Camp was built on the planet Naboo by the Trade Federation during the company's invasion there in 32 BBY. It contained a single command center built on a grassy area south of the city Harte Secur. A stone path began at the east of the camp and stretched north to Harte Secur. The camp was surrounded by herds of falumpaset and nerfs.

The camp belonged to the battle droid Commander OOM-14 of the Trade Federation Droid Army, who was in charge of one of five droid control programs that were necessary to keep the Federation's droids active. OOM-14 lost the program to the Royal Naboo Security Forces unit Force Command Two, and it was taken to a Harte Secur Research Center and used to deactivate OOM-14's division, numbering 72 B1 battle droids and eight anti-air battle droids, at the camp.

Trade Federation Viceroy Nute Gunray tasked the droid OOM-9 with retrieving the droid control program, sending him to the Deactivated Camp along with a Neimoidian technician. OOM-9 and a small force of droids raided the research center and reacquired the droid control program, bringing it to the camp and reactivating the droids there. Afterwards, OOM-9 used the droids to destroy Harte Secur, remaining at the camp along with five B1 battle droids—which he garrisoned inside the command center—two missile droids, and the technician.

The Deactivated Camp was first mentioned in Star Wars: Galactic Battlegrounds: Prima's Official Strategy Guide, released on November 7, 2001. It appeared and was identified in the LucasArts video game Star Wars: Galactic Battlegrounds, released on November 11, 2001. The Deactivated Camp appears in the second level of the Trade Federation campaign, "Behind the Lines," where its command center becomes available for the player to use to create units and buildings after retrieving the droid control program. However, the strategy guide states that creating units is unnecessary as the battle droids acquired throughout the level are sufficient to achieve victory. Unused audio files from the level feature Gunray instructing the player to establish a camp and gather resources.
